title: ‘Swatting’: An Intentionally False Alarm Brings in Big Guns
sub_head: Military-style police teams have given their name to a disturbing new kind of prank
body:
Linguist and lexicographer Ben Zimmer analyzes the origins of words in the news. Read previous columns here.
Last Sunday, three Ivy League universities—Cornell, Brown and Columbia—all reported that they had received bomb threats, just two days after a similar incident at Yale. Officials at the schools evacuated some facilities but found no evidence of damage or explosive devices. The New York Police Department announced that the Columbia bomb threat would be treated as “a swatting incident.”
